subsc: General industry and trade sector,Other domestic and international trade,Other social services,Compulsory pension and unemployment insurance,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Policy Reform Adjustment Loan
            (PRAL) Project has been designed as a one tranche adjustment
            operation, being built into the financing plan of the
            ongoing three-year IMF Extended Fund Facility. The project
            focuses on the various reforms and restructuring of the
            administration. Firstly, trade reforms are due to boost the
            economic growth and employment over the long term, with the
            new tariff structure reducing consumer prices. Secondly, the
            project examines domestic competition reforms, through the
            support of the Competition Law. Furthermore, the social
            security reform will strengthen public sector finances, in
            addition to improving the equity of social expenditures, and
            fostering savings and capital market development. The
            reduction of poverty and inequality is a major concern,
            being specifically addressed through the implementation of
            the Poverty Strategy and the corresponding Action Plan. One
            such action involves the improvement of the existing Poverty
            Map, through the combination of the Living Standards
            Measurement Survey (LSMS) and Census data, directly
            impacting the incidence of public spending.
